intro: Chuquiraga reticulata, commonly known as the Andean nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small yellowish flowers. The plant is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been traditionally used by indigenous communities for various purposes, including textiles and medicinal applications. Chuquiraga reticulata plays an important ecological role in its ecosystem, supporting local biodiversity and contributing to soil stability.
